CheckPoint: Torque and Angular Acceleration
A uniform solid disc of mass m and radius r is acted upon by three forces of given magnitudes (see the diagram).
Part 1. The angular acceleration of the disc if it rotates about the axis passing through the center of the disc, perpendicular to the page.
a. \(\alpha = 2F/mr\); counterclockwise
b. \(\alpha = 2F/mr\); clockwise
c. \(\alpha = 4F/mr\); counterclockwise
d. \(\alpha = 4F/mr\); clockwise
e. \(\alpha = 6F/mr\); counterclockwise
f. \(\alpha = 6F/mr\); clockwise
Part 2. Find the angular acceleration of the disc if it rotates about the axis passing through the point of application of force 3F, perpendicular to the page.
a. \(\alpha = 2F/mr\); counterclockwise
b. \(\alpha = 2F/mr\); clockwise
c. \(\alpha = 4F/mr\); counterclockwise
d. \(\alpha = 4F/mr\); clockwise
e. \(\alpha = 6F/mr\); counterclockwise
f. \(\alpha = 6F/mr\); clockwise
Part 3.
Find the angular acceleration of the disc if it rotates about the axis passing through the point of application of force 2F, perpendicular to the page.
a. \(\alpha = 8F/3mr\); counterclockwise
b. \(\alpha = 8F/3mr\); clockwise
c. \(\alpha = 4F/mr\); counterclockwise
d. \(\alpha = 4F/mr\); clockwise
e. \($\alpha = 2F/mr\); counterclockwise
f. \(\alpha = 2F/mr\); clockwise
